title: Experience
text:
Artificial Intelligence Engineer/ Quantitative Analyst- Global Markets May 2023 - September 2023
Royal Bank of Canada- Capital Markets Toronto, Canada
• Optimized machine learning models and quantitative analysis to innovate trading strategies for equity trading coverage
teams. Developed tailored data ingestion pipelines for real-time market data processing.

Undergraduate Researcher, Neuroinformatics September 2022- May 2023
Tripathy Lab, Krembil Center for Neuroinformatics, Cantre for Addiction And Mental Health Toronto, Canada
• Investigating Brain Transcriptomic Signatures of Race in Schizophrenia (SCZ) using Bioinformatics and other
computational tools such as RNA Sequencing, Differential Expression Analysis, Gene Ontology and Network Analysis.

Machine Learning Analyst- Global Markets May 2022- September 2022
Royal Bank of Canada- Capital Markets Toronto, Canada
• Developed machine learning models to analyze financial risk and forecast Cryptocurrency and Blockchain adoption
trends within Capital Markets strengthening strategic decision-making around digital assets.
• Conducted statistical analysis, applied mathematical optimization algorithms and data visualization to inform the bank’s
market intelligence and trend prediction capabilities around tokenization, digital assets as well and Web 3 security.

Machine Learning Fellow August 2021- January 2022
AI4Good Lab Montreal, Canada
• Selected as one of 30 women nationwide for a prestigious Machine Learning program aimed at leveraging Artificial
Intelligence for social good initiatives. Mentored by experts from Google DeepMind and the Vector Institute.
• Developed a proprietary AI model that utilizes satellite imagery to compile data analytics, in order to assist users to
easily track and assess social, economic, and environmental conditions. Recognized by the UNHCR for it’s potential.
• Won the Lab Accelerator Award- for the greatest startup potential and creating a positive global impact Article

Software Developer Intern May 2019 – August 2019
Toronto Dominion Bank- Fintech Innovation Team Toronto, Canada
• Developed Software that captured the entire flow of the Treasury Balance Sheet Management Team with benefits in cost
avoidance of CAD $15 Million yearly across the bank.
• Worked with Cloud Data Managers to re-configure the way quarterly reports were generated and consolidated across the
bank- resulting in more efficient processes, eliminating the avenue for manual errors.

Lead Web Developer & Blockchain Educator August 2020 – Present
CryptoChicks Toronto, Canada
• Lead the entire development of the company’s website from design to deployment phase. Working alongside the CEO
and Chief Marketing Officer to launch CryptoChicks Website & CryptoChicks Hatchery Website
• As Educator, I researched and compiled Blockchain & AI content to create educational content for the video scripts
course plans that were taught as part of the CryptoChicks Academy

Health Informatics Intern + Pharmaceutical lab Assistant June 2015 – September 2015
Rahma Pharmaceuticals & Investments Co. Ltd. Dubai, UAE
• Optimised and maintained SQL databases with pharmaceutical inventory by creating cleaner, easier to use structures.
• Generated progress reports of research findings and assisted in setting up the lab.

title: Projects
text:
Predictive Model- Socioeconomic Indicators June 2021
• Developed a deep convolution neural network that takes in satellite images and outputs educational indicators to produce
interactive maps identifying areas that are most in need of data. Allowing users to compile data, in order to easily assist,
track and assess social, economic, and environmental conditions.

Wellness Resources App November 2021
• Developed an Android mobile app that caters to the wellness of Black post-secondary students.
• Through a recommender system, it suggests black-owned healthcare and mental health professionals they may seek as
well as a platform to connect and create communities and safe spaces.
• Utilized the layout editor to create a UI for the application in order to allow different scenes to interact with each other.
Mealhth- Tone analyser (MedHacks 2020 Runner up) August 2020
• Designed a Web App that receives speech audio input and classifies it into an emotional state based on the user’s voice
tone
• Using this classification, the app produces a custom list of questions designed to analyze emotions and produces
action-based recommendations to provide coping abilities to the user.

title: Rayan Awad Alim
text:
Hello!
My name is Rayan Awad Alim, I am a 4th Year Computer Science, bioinformatics and statistics minor student at the University of Toronto!
